body: This works nicely overall. There is one problem though: if the map defines a win/lose video, it plays every time the dialog appears, not just once. I'm not sure if another approach that would just hide the endgame widget would be better.
OK I'll try to just hide the widget and not reload it every time.

How do I close the leave map window? I tried Ui.CloseWindow() but it doesn't work. Also the options button on the side panel is more complicated... Would it be easier to change the video logic? I can't find its code.

Does the current implementation have any disadvantages other than multiple video loading?
Which mission or custom map has game end video? So I can test it.
Yeah actually the way I had implemented this was completely wrong. I was reloading INGAME_ROOT everytime the window was closed. I changed that now and it acts like ingame menu.
This patch also makes the chat text field automatically get keyboard focus when chat tab is clicked.
I think this PR should wait for #8118 to be merged. It changes some keyboard focus behavior and I may need to adjust this accordingly. Some yield focus method calls may become unnecessary then.
Has dependencies label can be removed, I closed #8118. Also, this PR is not yet finished, there are some glitches, I'm trying to fix them.
Should I merge leave map widget into ingame menu? So it would be a version of the ingame menu that is displayed after game ends?
Leave map window could have settings and music buttons too...

OK, I think this feature is finished now. This patch makes it possible to look at the map after game has ended. Map is frozen, it is only possible to select units. I merged the script error and video display parts of LeaveMapLogic into GameInfoLogic, so they are shown in options menu now. Also removed all code related to leave map window.

Needs review and testing.

So this removes the `LEAVE_MAP_WIDGET`, moves the logic to the ingame menu, and uses that when the game ends, is that correct?

Also adds a `Return to map` button to that so you can spectate after the game is over.

I guess what it does now is that it freezes the game instead of throwing the `LEAVE_MAP_WIDGET` so you have to manually quit. I don't really understand the intention behind this tbh. Pretty sure players would mostly quit immediately and only 5% of the matches would end up with people checking out map after the game.

This PR does the following:
- Removes LeaveMap window.
- Doesn't show order cursor (move, attack etc.) after game end
- Doesn't play unit selection voices after game end
- Opens options menu when game ends.

That's it. It doesn't add a `Return to map` button to options menu because that already has `Resume` button. So after game ends, you get the options menu and you can close it and look at the map.

The reason for this patch is to be able to look at the map after game ends. There is no difference in how you quit the game. Instead of pressing `Leave` in LeaveMap window, you click `Abort Mission` in options menu.
You removed endgame statistics, congratulations! :-1: for removing the widget.

This PR started good, and I think people were generally happy with it. It has changed quite a lot since then though, and we have to reevaluate that.
Here is my opinion:
- Having to press `Abort Mission` at that point is just... confusing. Also is `Surrender` still active?
- The current setup has statistics and stuff which we don't want removed.
- Having a dedicated endgame widget allows mods to do all kinds of stuff at the end of a game/mission, like playing videos in a window, having cool banners, etc., which is not possible when we remove it and use the ingame menu.

So I'll have to :-1: the current implementation and request that you go back to a `Return to map` button.

Rebased.

When game ends, observer widgets are loaded. Statistics window can be opened with the button next to the one for the options menu.

Should the text of Abort mission button be changed to Leave after game ends? Surrender button is disabled for observers.

Maps can include custom end game video. Other than that, those customizations could be implemented for options menu too...

- It took me 2 games until I figured that I need to press "Resume" to go back and look at the map, which is something that will need to be discussed.
- User keyboard input is not ignored - you can order actors to deploy/undeploy, guard, attack, etc.

Leaving the `Changes requested` label for the second point.
Ok, I'll disable keyboard orders and change Resume button to Return to map.
I disabled unit hotkeys, changed `Resume` to `Return to map` and `Abort mission` to `Leave`. Also disabled all menu buttons and debug tab button when `Leave` is pressed. Needs review.
This removes a bunch of duplication that I was never 100% happy about, and fixes a long-standing complaint from many players.  :+1: after addressing @obrakmann's suggestion.
I merged the requested changes and rebased.
:+1: after https://github.com/deniz1a/OpenRA/pull/3 has been merged as well.
Should I squash all commits?

I'd leave five commits:

| Commit | Included commits |
| --- | --- |
| b4532d7 | 498b29c |
| 4cbc4fe | a3ead9f, 756fefd, dd32a4e, 8e1e53d, aa33ddf |
| d50053f |  |
| 54d21fa | 0604233 |
| d01f55f |  |
All squishy now.
A small button click for the maintainers, a giant leap for gameplay.
Thanks. [Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/1adbb780808cc4ad810324bf6ed52a32b58e5141%5E...1adbb780808cc4ad810324bf6ed52a32b58e5141)
